column4: can somebody tell me how i can fix this problem? whenever i boot linux the cpu fan stops, currently i'm trying to install and it keep crashing because it overheats.
can you control the fan in the BIOS?
no i don't think i can. i read on the forum i have to add something to boot/grub/menu.lst something like acpi
im on the verge of crashing i think
In the grub menu, can you hit e and add that line before you boot?
Oh, in that case can you hit F6 (other options) at the livecd menu and add it?
No guarantees, but its worth a shot.  I'm learning things as I go around here.
i'm back, you fixed my problem. thanks so much now I just have to install and I wont have to deal with crashes anymore hopefully!
You may have to add that line to grub later, I don't know if it will automatically do that once it installs.
yeah i know. i just have to do this command once i've installed. sudo gedit boot/grub/menu.lst
but for now i can install without worrying anymore =)
